content:
• Friday, March 9, 2012
  • P

    Pandora (P +7.2%) rallied today after being crushed following a weak Q4 report (I, II), even...

    Pandora (P +7.2%) rallied today after being crushed following a weak Q4 report (I, II), even though BTIG's Richard Greenfield reaffirmed his bearish stance. Greenfield, who made waves in September by establishing a $3.75 PT for Pandora, is worried the Internet radio leader provides an ineffective platform for display and video ads, and risks alienating customers by increasing the number of audio ads it serves. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • ANTH

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) halts its VISTA-16 clinical study due to a lack of efficacy...

    Anthera Pharmaceuticals (OTC:ANTH) halts its VISTA-16 clinical study due to a lack of efficacy that could not be reasonably overcome in the remainder of the trial, following a recommendation by the Independent Data Safety Monitoring Board. ANTH -63.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • GMET

    GeoMet (NASDAQ:GMET) says year-end 2011 estimated proved natural gas reserves totaled...

    GeoMet (NASDAQ:GMET) says year-end 2011 estimated proved natural gas reserves totaled approximately 198 bcf, including approximately 49 Bcf acquired in a previously announced acquisition that closed in November, 2011. The present value of future net cash flows attributable to proved reserves at year end was approximately $173M. Shares spiked higher at the close to finish +15.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • XRTX

    Xyratex (XRTX -4.6%) shares slide after Stifel Nicolaus cut its rating to Hold from Buy,...

    Xyratex (XRTX -4.6%) shares slide after Stifel Nicolaus cut its rating to Hold from Buy, asserting that the stock now has a more balanced risk/reward after an 80% rally since October. Despite some upside potential, but "uncertainty in the post Western Digital-Hitachi GST combination spending" warrants increased caution at current prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • APC

    Anadarko's (APC +1.9%) resolution to its long-standing arbitration dispute with Algeria is worth...

    Anadarko's (APC +1.9%) resolution to its long-standing arbitration dispute with Algeria is worth $8.80 per share, says Buckingham. Under the settlement, Algeria will supply Anadarko with approximately $1.8B in crude oil over the next year. The firm currently rates the shares as a Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP +2.6%) is maintained at Buy with a $55 target price at Deutsche Bank after analysts...

    NetApp (NTAP +2.6%) is maintained at Buy with a $55 target price at Deutsche Bank after analysts meet with CFO Nick Noviello and SVP Jay Kidd. The firm see "multiple growth drivers ahead including ONTAP 8.1, Romley datacenter upgrades, and future HW refreshes which should support improving growth [and] profitability going forward."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • RDS.A

    Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -1.8%) dips after being downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform on...

    Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -1.8%) dips after being downgraded to Market Perform from Outperform on valuation at Bernstein.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MRVL

    Shares of chip maker Cavium (CAVM +2.1%) gain after Jefferies raises its rating to Buy from Hold...

    Shares of chip maker Cavium (CAVM +2.1%) gain after Jefferies raises its rating to Buy from Hold with a $44 price target, up from $32, writing that CAVM may benefit from the rollout of wireless base station equipment that’s cheaper and simpler, to serve the expansion of both 3G cellular networks and emerging LTE networks.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • CDTI

    Emissions-control company Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +9.2%) jumps after naming...

    Emissions-control company Clean Diesel Technologies (OTC:CDTI +9.2%) jumps after naming Honeywell International (HON +0.6%) executive R. Craig Breese as its new president and CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecommunications (CMTL +3%) moves up after beating FQ2 estimates late yesterday....

    Comtech Telecommunications (CMTL +3%) moves up after beating FQ2 estimates late yesterday. Earnings actually fell 64% Y/Y as the seller of radio-frequency amplifiers used in aircraft communications continues to see its revenue drop.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ZEP

    Shares of Zep Inc. (ZEP +4.9%) get a boost on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at BB&T, citing...

    Shares of Zep Inc. (ZEP +4.9%) get a boost on an upgrade to Buy on valuation at BB&T, citing improving fundamentals.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT -1.1%) dips after Argus cut the shares to Sell earlier today, citing concerns...

    Medtronic (MDT -1.1%) dips after Argus cut the shares to Sell earlier today, citing concerns regarding slowing sales growth and its three largest franchises, which is being driven by secular factors rather than cyclical.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • ILG

    Shares of Interval Leisure Group (IILG +15.8%) pop after its Q4 results top estimates, and the...

    Shares of Interval Leisure Group (IILG +15.8%) pop after its Q4 results top estimates, and the company also declares a 10-cent quarterly dividend.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • CWST

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST +1.1%) bucks a lower opening on an S&P downgrade and trades...

    Casella Waste Systems (CWST +1.1%) bucks a lower opening on an S&P downgrade and trades higher. The ratings agency cut trash hauler deeper into junk territory late yesterday due to limited headroom under its financial covenants.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • APC

    Though Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) is up 2.8% on word that it might be in line to receive a...

    Though Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) is up 2.8% on word that it might be in line to receive a $4.4B payout from a resolution over a tax dispute in Algeria, RBC Capital Market's Scott Hanold thinks the full value of the settlement isn't priced in yet. "We expect APC shares to trade up higher by at least 5%. The $4.4 billion in value equates to just under $9/share."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA +0.1%) says over 3.5M copies of Mass Effect 3 have shipped since the sci-fi...

    Electronic Arts (EA +0.1%) says over 3.5M copies of Mass Effect 3 have shipped since the sci-fi role-playing game went on sale on Tuesday to positive reviews. The strong reception comes after EA's Battlefield 3 sold 5M copies in its first week of sales in October. Meanwhile, GameStop (GME -1.1%) is underperforming following the release of NPD's February data.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVB

    AvalonBay (AVB +2.5%) moves higher on an upgrade to Top Pick on valuation at RBC Capital, citing...

    AvalonBay (AVB +2.5%) moves higher on an upgrade to Top Pick on valuation at RBC Capital, citing low leverage, a strong balance sheet and ample liquidity.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM
  • ESRX

    The FTC is increasingly unlikely to block the Express Scripts (ESRX +1.8%)/Medco (MHS +1.7%)...

    The FTC is increasingly unlikely to block the Express Scripts (ESRX +1.8%)/Medco (MHS +1.7%) deal, reports the WSJ. It's not a surprise, but the stocks get a nice pop on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • DYN

    Dynergy (DYN -30.5%) plummets after a public examiner says its transfer of coal assets to its...

    Dynergy (DYN -30.5%) plummets after a public examiner says its transfer of coal assets to its parent company was fraudulent, and to the detriment of creditors. The examiner was appointed at the request of bondholders shortly after Dynergy filed for bankruptcy in November.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRS

    Verso Paper (VRS +22.4%) soars for the second straight day after announcing a $345M debt...

    Verso Paper (VRS +22.4%) soars for the second straight day after announcing a $345M debt offering, as well as lender commitments for $200M in new credit facilities. Verso, which is struggling to deal with major losses and a heavy debt load, intends to use the proceeds to redeem high-interest debt. Shares have now more than doubled since the news was announced.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments' (TXN -1.2%) reduced outlook may indicate weak Kindle Fire sales, given the...

    Texas Instruments' (TXN -1.2%) reduced outlook may indicate weak Kindle Fire sales, given the reaction in Amazon (AMZN -1.9%) shares; the Kindle Fire runs on a TI OMAP 4430 processor. TI says weak demand from a few OMAP customers led it to adjust its numbers; most analysts pin the blame on Kindle, a few see Nokia (NYSE:NOK) and RIMM, but most seem inclined to hang in for a turnaround.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • BAXS

    TranS1 (TSON -5.3%) dips after posting disappointing Q4 results. Revenue fell 32% Y/Y despite a...

    TranS1 (TSON -5.3%) dips after posting disappointing Q4 results. Revenue fell 32% Y/Y despite a sharp improvement in margins, as the company continues to post declining revenue and quarterly losses. Additionally, the medical device maker forecast Q1 revenue to be lower, now expecting to earn between $3.5M - $3.9M, below the Street consensus forecast of $4M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp's (MCP +13.6%) acquisition of Neo Material is also providing a big lift to shares of...

    Molycorp's (MCP +13.6%) acquisition of Neo Material is also providing a big lift to shares of fellow rare earth miners Rare Element Resources (REE +15.7%) and Tasman Metals (TAS +18.7%), as investors bet the deal will spur further consolidation. Avalon Rare Metals (AVL +5.1%) is up more modestly.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 2 Comments

  • Gold's up-and-down day adds to the uncertainty over the metal. Analysts say that sentiment is...

    Gold's up-and-down day adds to the uncertainty over the metal. Analysts say that sentiment is shaky amongst traders with no clear definition of where the floor for prices really stands.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • YRCW

    YRC Worldwide (YRCW +5.1%) is trading higher today, after earlier agreeing to sell its interest...

    YRC Worldwide (YRCW +5.1%) is trading higher today, after earlier agreeing to sell its interest in Shanghai Jiayu Logistics to its 35% joint venture partner, as the struggling trucking company continues to sharpen its focus on the North American less-than-truckload business.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • THO

    Thor Industries' (THO -1.8%) posted a strong revenue beat during FQ2, and the RV and bus maker...

    Thor Industries' (THO -1.8%) posted a strong revenue beat during FQ2, and the RV and bus maker says retail activity remained strong in February. But "higher fuel and a competitive discounting activity makes the company cautiously optimistic," Citi analysts say, understandable since the RV industry took a big hit when gasoline spiked to record highs in 2008.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (ZUMZ +3.5%) moves up after posting a Q4 largely in-line with estimates. Earnings rose...

    Zumiez (ZUMZ +3.5%) moves up after posting a Q4 largely in-line with estimates. Earnings rose 25% Y/Y as the teen-focused retailer continued to see strong same-store sales growth with a boost from price increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • CVI

    CVR Energy (CVI +4.4%) jumps after Carl Icahn issues an open letter blasting a recent statement...

    CVR Energy (CVI +4.4%) jumps after Carl Icahn issues an open letter blasting a recent statement made by the company regarding Icahn's $30/share tender offer as "disingenuous and misleading." Icahn says he plans to "conduct a full and open process" to sell CVR if he manages to gain control of the company, but says he will drop his bid if his offer doesn't leave him with a majority stake by March 23.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -6.3%) says the number of paid prescriptions for its primary...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR -6.3%) says the number of paid prescriptions for its primary product, Acthar, dipped M/M in February. The result contrasts with the general pattern of explosive growth for Acthar, as QCOR has quickly built up its salesforce to promote the drug used to treat multiple sclerosis and other diseases.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • P

    Consumers love Pandora (P +3.3%), but it's just not a good business, Steve Birenberg writes....

    Consumers love Pandora (P +3.3%), but it's just not a good business, Steve Birenberg writes. Active users and time spent per listener per day are exploding, yet every song listened to on Pandora carries a real cost which is increasing every year. Also, there's no infrastructure in place to sell local advertising needed to gain market share vs. old radio.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (PLL-OLD -3.1%) is the S&P's top loser after J.P. Morgan cuts shares to Underweight...

    Pall (PLL-OLD -3.1%) is the S&P's top loser after J.P. Morgan cuts shares to Underweight following a weak FQ2 report. PLL made it clear in its conference call that its rate of volume growth for 2012 is slowing, the firm says; FQ2 sales measured in local currency rose 8%, but orders rose 3.4%. PLL thus has a "reasonable probability" of missing estimates in coming quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • VCEL

    Shares of Aastrom Biosciences (ASTM) come off a trading halt up 20.5% after the company says it...

    Shares of Aastrom Biosciences (ASTM) come off a trading halt up 20.5% after the company says it landed a $40M private placement for its Series B convertible stock that helps it raise capital without diluting common stock shareholders for 5 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • NKE

    Nike (NKE +1.8%) moves up after Citigroup says it anticipates more upside despite the stock's...

    Nike (NKE +1.8%) moves up after Citigroup says it anticipates more upside despite the stock's recent rally, and raises its price target to $123 from $115. Citi notes the sports apparel giant could report futures up 16% - 17% on March 22 due to higher prices in its retail line, the NFL license and momentum in footwear.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM

  • Precious metals reverse big early losses in the wake of the payroll report and pop sharply...

    Precious metals reverse big early losses in the wake of the payroll report and pop sharply higher over the past 60 minutes. Gold +0.7% to $1,710, silver +0.9% to $34.12. Crude oil is on the move as well, +1.3% to $107.97.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 2 Comments
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT +3%) trades higher after announcing it's spending $43M to acquire Loopt, a...

    Green Dot (GDOT +3%) trades higher after announcing it's spending $43M to acquire Loopt, a developer of mobile apps that allow users to obtain and share information about local businesses. Green Dot claims Loopt will help boost sales of its prepaid debit cards, and allow Green Dot to become a leader in mobile payments and rewards. It's also claimed Loopt holds several valuable patents that are relevant to mobile marketing. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • MCPIQ

    Stifel Nicolaus views Molycorp's (MCP +11.6%) acquisition of Neo Material Technologies...

    Stifel Nicolaus views Molycorp's (MCP +11.6%) acquisition of Neo Material Technologies (OTC:NEMFF) as a positive vertical integration move for the rare metal producer. The firm expects the deal to be accretive in 2012 but it maintains a Hold rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • AMRN

    While the good news for investors of Amarin (AMRN +1.1%) is that development on its experimental...

    While the good news for investors of Amarin (AMRN +1.1%) is that development on its experimental heart drug derived from fish oil is churning right along, the bad news is that the USPTO can't keep up with the pace to help the company keep generic versions at bay. Leerink Swann predicts the patent office will eventually grant approval after a lengthy appeals process, as it maintains an Outperformance rating and $25 price target on the biotech firm.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • DIOD

    Analog chipmaker Diodes (DIOD +5.7%) jumps after slightly adjusting its Q1 revenue guidance...

    Analog chipmaker Diodes (DIOD +5.7%) jumps after slightly adjusting its Q1 revenue guidance range to $140M-$148M (prior range was $138M-$148M), a move that calmed investors who have seen earnings estimates for the company steadily move lower. Diodes' gross margin and operating expense guidance remains unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) runs up a 9.1% gain, following closely on the heels of a 7% gainer yesterday on...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) runs up a 9.1% gain, following closely on the heels of a 7% gainer yesterday on indications that the carrier is picking up customers from rivals. Shares now trade at a 2012 high.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 3 Comments
  • JKS

    Jinko Solar (JKS +8.3%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at Auriga but with its target price...

    Jinko Solar (JKS +8.3%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at Auriga but with its target price lowered to $5 from $7 given the stock price correction. The firm notes JKS is in trouble with the worst cash conversion cycle among peers. The company reported a Q4 loss on weaker revenue and lower margins amid softer selling prices, but shipments beat company guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • HMIN

    Home Inns & Motels (HMIN -7.1%) trades lower after missing EPS estimates by a dime with its Q4...

    Home Inns & Motels (HMIN -7.1%) trades lower after missing EPS estimates by a dime with its Q4 report and issuing tepid guidance for 2012 revenue.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • SBUX

    William Blair weighs in on Starbucks' (SBUX +2%) new single-serve brewing system Verismo, saying...

    William Blair weighs in on Starbucks' (SBUX +2%) new single-serve brewing system Verismo, saying it looks most similar to Nestle's (OTCPK:NSRGY -1%) Nespresso platform. The firm believes Verismo could prove to be a winner if executed correctly, potentially limiting Nespresso in the United States, and reiterates its Outperform rating on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • AOBC

    Shares of Smith & Wesson (SWHC) ride a FQ3 earnings beat 22.1% higher on huge volume....

    Shares of Smith & Wesson (SWHC) ride a FQ3 earnings beat 22.1% higher on huge volume. Catching the eye of investors is the raised forecast for full year sales on strong demand for handguns and sporting rifles.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM
  • VOLC

    Medical device maker Volcano (VOLC +3.5%) trades higher on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The...

    Medical device maker Volcano (VOLC +3.5%) trades higher on an upgrade to Buy from Goldman. The firm cites "increased confidence" in Volcano's rapidly-growing Fractional Flow Reserve business, which can reduce healthcare costs by "improving patient selection and clinical outcomes" for coronary stent procedures.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • JVA

    Shares of Coffee Holdings (JVA +18.5%) rip higher after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.24 and revenues...

    Shares of Coffee Holdings (JVA +18.5%) rip higher after reporting Q4 EPS of $0.24 and revenues of $56.6M, vs. consensus views calling for EPS of $0.24 and revenues of $43M. The stock is considered a favorite of both short-sellers and coffee speculators.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM

  • The bid comes out of gold and silver following the NFP report, with traders apparently believing...

    The bid comes out of gold and silver following the NFP report, with traders apparently believing continuing solid employment numbers lessens the chances for additional QE. Gold is at 1,681/oz., silver at $33.29. GLD -1%, SLV -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • RUTH

    Ruth's Hospitality (RUTH +5.4%) will repurchase and retire all of outstanding shares of its...

    Ruth's Hospitality (RUTH +5.4%) will repurchase and retire all of outstanding shares of its Series A 10% convertible preferred stock owned by one of its largest shareholders for $60.2M. As a result of the buyback, RUTH's diluted common stock share count decreases by ~8.6M shares and the 10% dividend on the preferred stock is eliminated.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • GMCR

    Canaccord defends Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -17.1%) following Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX)...

    Canaccord defends Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR -17.1%) following Starbucks' (NASDAQ:SBUX) unveiling of the Verismo (I, II), backing up Green Mountain's assertion that the system is focused on lattes and espressos, thus making it only "modestly competitive" with Keurig and Vue brewers. It's added Nestle's Nespresso systems, cited by Starbucks as competition, haven't impact Keurig's success. BofA is less sanguine, and is downgrading shares to Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • CCL

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) and Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) ease lower on reports of potential cruise...

    Carnival (NYSE:CCL) and Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) ease lower on reports of potential cruise booking delays. While most cruise industry players voice optimism for the long-term, the full impact of the Costa Concordia disaster will become apparent in the coming weeks and months as cruises for 2013 go on sale. CCL -0.4%, RCL -1.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • UUP

    The dollar is moving sharply higher against most major currencies following the jobs report....

    The dollar is moving sharply higher against most major currencies following the jobs report. It's the opposite of recent market action where, perversely, strong U.S. economic news saw the greenback drop as money moved into "risk" assets, of which the euro, the pound, and the aussie are now thought of. The euro -1.1%, pound -0.7%, aussie -0.4%, yen -1.1%. UUP +0.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM | 1 Comment
  • APC

    Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) +3.8% premarket after announcing a resolution of a long-running...

    Anadarko Petroleum (NYSE:APC) +3.8% premarket after announcing a resolution of a long-running tax dispute with Algeria. Under the settlement, Algeria would supply APC with $1.8B in crude oil over the next 12 months; APC and Algeria will amend their existing production sharing agreement to provide APC with a discount of oil worth ~$2.6B over the life of the contract.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • QSFT

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT) enters into a merger agreement with affiliates of Insight Venture...

    Quest Software (NASDAQ:QSFT) enters into a merger agreement with affiliates of Insight Venture Partners to be taken private, with shareholders not affiliated with the buyout group in line to receive $23 a share. The deal values the company at close to $2B. Shares +19.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:55 AM

  • Treasury prices head south following the solid NFP report, Thirty-year bond futures diving more...

    Treasury prices head south following the solid NFP report, Thirty-year bond futures diving more than half a point. Moving in the other direction is the yield, +4 basis points to 3.22%. On the short end, September 2014 Eurodollar futures budge 3.5 basis points lower, pricing in a slightly greater chance of future Fed rate hikes.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • RENN

    Chinese social networking site Renren (NYSE:RENN) +7.1% premarket after reporting a Q4 profit...

    Chinese social networking site Renren (NYSE:RENN) +7.1% premarket after reporting a Q4 profit mainly on one-time gains, vs. a loss last year. Revenue rose 57% Y/Y, but lower margins led to an operating loss for the period; online advertising revenue grew 66% Y/Y. RENN offers a strong revenue outlook for the full year 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM

  • U.S. stock index futures pop a bit higher after the NFP print, pretty much inline, but with a...

    U.S. stock index futures pop a bit higher after the NFP print, pretty much inline, but with a sizable revision higher to the January number. S&P +0.2%. European shares reverse small losses, Stoxx 50 +0.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) jumps 3.8% premarket after reporting positive initial results...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM) jumps 3.8% premarket after reporting positive initial results from a Phase II trial of its lung cancer treatment. The company says it will release the most critical data from the study in the second half of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • NES

    Along with reporting disappointing Q4 results, Heckmann (HEK) will acquire waste recycler and...

    Along with reporting disappointing Q4 results, Heckmann (HEK) will acquire waste recycler and environmental services company Thermo Fluids for $245M. The acquisition would be “immediately accretive” to 2012 earnings, and is projected to generate revenue of $105M-$115M for the final nine months of FY2012. HEK -3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:23 AM
  • NVAX

    Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.85M misses by $1M. Shares...

    Novavax (NASDAQ:NVAX): Q4 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $5.85M misses by $1M. Shares +3.8% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • BODY

    Shares of Body Central (OTCQB:BODY) sink 7.4% in premarket trading after the firm comes in with...

    Shares of Body Central (OTCQB:BODY) sink 7.4% in premarket trading after the firm comes in with guidance for Q1 EPS of $0.34-$0.36, below the consensus mark of analysts that calls for $0.39.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 AM
  • CAAS

    China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $99.5M (-1%...

    China Automotive Systems (NASDAQ:CAAS): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $99.5M (-1% Y/Y) beats by $3.3M. Shares +4.6% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) responds to Starbucks single-cup coffee...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) responds to Starbucks single-cup coffee announcement with a statement backing its Keurig brewing system and saying that it plans to partner with Luigi Lavazza on a high-pressure capsule-based espresso system. Shares -14.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 AM | 3 Comments
